title: How to Beat Bowser in Super Mario Run

steps.headline: Start the game.
steps.description: If you haven't purchased the game yet, you can easily download the game through the App Store for free-you can either enter the title of the game into the App Store's search bar, or search for "Super Mario Run" into your browser's search bar.

steps.headline: Enter the level.
steps.description: In order to enter Bowser's level, you have to tap "Tour" while inside the game; then select the green castle. Make sure you've beaten all the other levels first, or you won't be able to access the castle.

steps.headline: Avoid getting hit.
steps.description: If you do, you can get a power-up to quickly make up for any loss, but you only have about three bubbles to aid an unfortunate turn-unless you happened to turn on Easy Mode before the start of the game.

steps.headline: Kick back the bombs Bowser throws.
steps.description: This is one way to defeat Bowser. Simply bump into the bombs to deal damage, while also keeping from taking damage. However, you must make sure you hit it back on the exact same level as the level Bowser is on, or else the bombs won't do anything.

steps.headline: Jump over the axe at the end of the "battle room" (optional).
steps.description: Sometimes, you can make your way past Bowser by using the pause blocks and jumping over the axe at the end of the battle room instead of attacking him with bombs, but it's optional.

steps.headline: Collect all the power-ups that you can, including coins, 1-Ups, and mushrooms.
steps.description: They're essential to your survival of the level, and will also aid you in the battle with Bowser. But try not to lose them, of course!

steps.headline: Remember that your time is limited, unless you turned on Easy Mode before the game start.
steps.description: Try to defeat Bowser quickly and easily, because the limited time is 60 seconds. But there is a plus side: every time you hit Bowser with the bombs, you'll earn about 10-20 additional seconds.

steps.headline: Continue playing!
steps.description: If you lose, try practicing defeating Bowser/completing Bowser's level by entering another level, and then try again, and even if you win, try playing the level again! You could count the record of time in which you win, or how easily you win the battle. Be creative!

text: Start the game. If you haven't purchased the game yet, you can easily download the game through the App Store for free-you can either enter the title of the game into the App Store's search bar, or search for "Super Mario Run" into your browser's search bar. Enter the level. In order to enter Bowser's level, you have to tap "Tour" while inside the game; then select the green castle. Make sure you've beaten all the other levels first, or you won't be able to access the castle. Avoid getting hit. If you do, you can get a power-up to quickly make up for any loss, but you only have about three bubbles to aid an unfortunate turn-unless you happened to turn on Easy Mode before the start of the game. Kick back the bombs Bowser throws. This is one way to defeat Bowser. Simply bump into the bombs to deal damage, while also keeping from taking damage. However, you must make sure you hit it back on the exact same level as the level Bowser is on, or else the bombs won't do anything. Jump over the axe at the end of the "battle room" (optional). Sometimes, you can make your way past Bowser by using the pause blocks and jumping over the axe at the end of the battle room instead of attacking him with bombs, but it's optional. Collect all the power-ups that you can, including coins, 1-Ups, and mushrooms. They're essential to your survival of the level, and will also aid you in the battle with Bowser. But try not to lose them, of course! Remember that your time is limited, unless you turned on Easy Mode before the game start. Try to defeat Bowser quickly and easily, because the limited time is 60 seconds. But there is a plus side: every time you hit Bowser with the bombs, you'll earn about 10-20 additional seconds. Continue playing! If you lose, try practicing defeating Bowser/completing Bowser's level by entering another level, and then try again, and even if you win, try playing the level again! You could count the record of time in which you win, or how easily you win the battle. Be creative!
